metadata.title: Academic Abilities
metadata.description: Scholarly abilities requiring formal education or extensive study

abilities.name: Artes Liberales
abilities.description: The seven liberal arts: grammar, rhetoric, logic, arithmetic, geometry, astronomy, and music theory.
uses: Required for ceremonial casting of rituals
abilities.advancement: Study (academic texts), Training (from scholars), Practice (academic work)
abilities.notes: Essential for ritual magic and scholarly pursuits

abilities.name: Civil and Canon Law
abilities.description: Knowledge of legal systems, both secular and church law.
abilities.advancement: Study (legal texts), Training (from lawyers), Practice (legal work)

abilities.name: Dead Language
abilities.description: Reading and writing languages no longer spoken, such as Latin or ancient Greek.
abilities.advancement: Study (texts in the language), Training (from scholars)
abilities.notes: Each dead language requires a separate ability. Latin is essential for most scholarship

abilities.name: Medicine
abilities.description: Theoretical knowledge of the human body, disease, and medical treatment.
abilities.advancement: Study (medical texts), Training (from physicians), Practice (treating patients)

abilities.name: Philosophy
abilities.description: Knowledge of philosophical thought, logic, and metaphysical questions.
abilities.advancement: Study (philosophical works), Training (from philosophers), Practice (debate and discussion)

abilities.name: Theology
abilities.description: Knowledge of religious doctrine, scripture, and divine matters.
abilities.advancement: Study (religious texts), Training (from clergy), Practice (religious instruction)
